The Desert :: Deserts of the World

I’m from lush old growth forests full of ferns but I fell in love with fairydusters and ocotillo and the wide open expanse of the desert. Good flying weather and you can see where you’re going. These are from North America and the Middle East.

Yodaville in the wide expanse of the Barry Goldwater Bombing Range, Arizona.

Mojave National Preserve, California

Air pockets from hot lava blew out holes in the rock. Mojave National Preserve.

The river in July near Al Asad Air Base in Iraq.

No really, it goes on forever. Al Asad Air Base, Iraq.

Not Abraham’s Palm Grove, Al Asad Air Base, Iraq.

The sky after an epic rainstorm. Al Asad Air Base, Iraq.

Euphrates River in July, Al Asad Air Base, Iraq.

Outside the city walls of Doha, Qatar.

The All-American Canal that siphons water from the Colorado River for Los Angeles.

Kayaking on the Colorado River near Yuma, Arizona.

Date fields flooded in the evening for more efficient irrigation. Yuma, Arizona.

A hazy afternoon in flight. Arizona.

Looking toward Kitt Peak. Tucson, Arizona.

That there way lies Mexico. Taken over Tucson? Or was it Nogales?

Mittry Lake north of Yuma, Arizona.

A small pond, likely high in leached iron, near Mittry Lake, Arizona.

Palm Canyon contains Arizona’s only native palms. Kofa National Wildlife Refuge.

A lone Ocotillo in Kofa National Wildlife Refuge, Arizona.

Cactus in the West Saguaro National Park. Tucson, Arizona.

Dale Chihuly blown-glass installation at the Phoenix Desert Botanical Garden.

Stockyards and farmland on the desert floor. Near Mohawk and Wells, Arizona.

Swastika-inscribed bridge beside a defunct USRS 1930s dam near Mittry Lake, Arizona.

Running water hidden from the main road near Mittry Lake, Arizona.
